name: Zinc Biofortification in Wheat
description: This meta-analysis examines how Zn fertilizer application (soil, foliar, and soil+foliar) affects grain Zn concentration in wheat. The goal is agronomic biofortification to address Zn deficiency in human nutrition. Based on Hui et al. 2025 (Nature Communications 16:3913), 139 studies, 2,771 observations.
intervention: Zinc fertilizer application (ZnSO4, ZnO, Zn-EDTA, etc. via soil, foliar, or combined application)
typical_effect_size: +29% for soil application, +55% for foliar, +62% for soil+foliar
important_moderators: Zn fertilizer type (ZnSO4, ZnO, Zn-EDTA, etc.)
Spraying timing (booting, heading, flowering, grain filling)
extraction_priorities: 1. CRITICAL: Extract EVERY treatment combination separately - no pooling across Zn rates, application methods, or timings
2. Control = no Zn application (CK), treatment = with Zn application
3. If factorial design (Zn rate x timing x form), extract each combination vs its control
4. Get variance (SE/SD/LSD) and sample size (n) - many papers use LSD
5. Record the Zn application rate, method, and fertilizer type for each observation
6. Also extract grain yield and biomass when available alongside Zn concentration
tc_confusion_warnings: Control is the zero-Zn treatment, not untreated plants
Some papers use multiple Zn rates - extract EACH rate vs the zero-Zn control
Foliar vs soil application are different treatments, not replicates
LSD is very common - extract it as a variance measure
Some papers report Zn biofortification index - this is derived, extract raw concentrations
